content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals, 4 plus, the integral from 1 to x, of, the fraction with numerator 1 and denominator 1 plus t, end fraction, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>. Which of the following is an equation for the line tangent to the graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="y minus 4 equals, one half times, open parenthesis, x minus 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>=</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="y minus 4 equals, one fourth times, open parenthesis, x minus 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>=</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="y minus 4 equals, the fraction 9 over 2, end fraction, times, open parenthesis, x minus 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>=</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="y minus 4 equals, one half times, open parenthesis, x minus 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>=</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

topic.text: 6.4: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Accumulation Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
